Congratulations to Rosspoint Elementary School eighth grader Anna Day on being chosen as a winner of Scholastic Inc. Scope's Paired Texts Contest from the December 2019/January 2020 issue.
Day, a student in Mrs. Malissa Lewis' class, and her fellow students submitted essays to the contest. Her winning entry addressed similarities between Big Tobacco and the e-cigarette industry.
Kristin Lewis, editorial director for Scope, called Day's work "interesting and informative. Great work!"
She encouraged Day to continue reading and writing and thanked her for helping to make the contest a success.
Day received a prize copy of "Shouting at the Rain" by Lynda Mullaly Hunt.
